intro: Amischotolype glabrata, commonly known as the smooth amischotolype, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
